metadata.title: The Midterms
metadata.time_reference: Immediately following an assassination attempt on the President

notes: This episode deals with the aftermath of an assassination attempt on the President and how it impacts the staff.
The storyline includes election preparations which reflect real-world political campaigns.

in_universe_mythology: The relationship between the President and the staff reflects themes of loyalty and responsibility in governance.
real_world_cultural_references: References to American politics and the influence of media and public opinion.
Jenna Jacobs character inspired by real-life figure Dr. Laura Schlessinger.
items: Polling data regarding the mid-term elections
Campaign materials related to congressional races

continuity_notes: Set shortly after Season 2 Episode 2, addressing events from previous episodes and maintaining narrative consistency.

plot.plot_summary: The episode follows the White House staff as they campaign for upcoming mid-term elections after a recent assassination attempt on President Bartlet. The staff deals with various personal and professional challenges, including managing media relations, supporting a congressional candidate, and coping with the psychological impacts of violence and political pressure.
